meanings.definition: To sell (something) before it is officially available for purchase.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to presell their new product to loyal customers before the launch.
meanings.sent2: They presell tickets for the concert to ensure a full house on the day of the event.
meanings.sent3: Trying to presell a time machine might be a tough sell!
meanings.sent4: The author managed to presell the idea of his upcoming book to eager readers.
meanings.sent5: She used her charm to presell the idea of a surprise party to her best friend.

meanings.definition: To promote or generate interest in (something) before it is released.
meanings.sent1: The movie studio decided to presell the film by releasing exciting trailers.
meanings.sent2: They presell the new video game by showcasing its amazing graphics and gameplay.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to presell his disappearing act, but the audience remained skeptical.
meanings.sent4: The artist managed to presell her upcoming exhibition by sharing sneak peeks of her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used creative methods to presell the upcoming science experiment to her students.
